head.title: Trade Schools in Decline: The Wrong Message

hedline.hl1: Trade Schools in Decline: The Wrong Message

abstract.p: Judith D Wallach letter on June 21 article deplores decline in trade school education

block.p: Re ''Schools Turning From Teaching the Trades'' (front page, June 21): We give our youth the message that only academic skills are worth developing and fashioning into a career, and that is a terrible waste of talent.

If our high school graduation policy required a student to know not only English, math and the various social studies, but also how to fix a broken electric cord and construct a table, work in the ''trades'' might again become a respectable aspiration.

Re ''Schools Turning From Teaching the Trades'' (front page, June 21): We give our youth the message that only academic skills are worth developing and fashioning into a career, and that is a terrible waste of talent.

If our high school graduation policy required a student to know not only English, math and the various social studies, but also how to fix a broken electric cord and construct a table, work in the ''trades'' might again become a respectable aspiration.
At my own alma mater, the Ethical Culture Fieldston School, carpentry and cooking were as basic to the curriculum as arts and academics were. I am grateful for that broad, yet basic, education.
JUDITH D. WALLACH New York, June 21, 2000
